m4i_analytics.graphs.languages.archimate.ArchimateUtils module¶

class m4i_analytics.graphs.languages.archimate.ArchimateUtils.ArchimateUtils[source]¶
PARSER_NAME = 'archimate3'¶
static load_model(format=<ModelFormat.JSON: 'json'>)[source]¶

Loads the provided raw model (as retrieved from the repository) into an ArchimateModel instance, which provides separate Pandas Dataframes of the nodes, edges, views and organizations in your model.

Returns:

An ArchimateModel instance containing the nodes, edges, views and organizations from the provided model as separate Pandas Dataframes.
Return type:

ArchimateModel
Parameters:
  • raw_model (str) – The unparsed model string as retrieved from the repository
  • format (ModelFormat) – The format in which you retrieved the model. This needs to match the actual format of the model for the loading to complete successfully.
Raises:

ValueError – Thrown when the raw model could not be parsed as the expected format.
static load_model_from_repository(projectName, branchName, userid, version=None)[source]¶

Retrieves a model matching the parameters provided from the repository and loads it into an ArchimateModel instance

Returns:

An ArchimateModel instance containing the nodes and relationships from the provided model as separate Pandas Dataframes.
Return type:

ArchimateModel
Parameters:
  • projectOwner (str) – The username of the owner of the project containing the model.
  • projectName (str) – The name of the project containing the model.
  • branchName (str) – The specific branch of the model you wish to retrieve.
  • userid (str) – The name of the user performing this action.
  • version (long) – Optional.The version of the model you wish to retrieve. If you leave this empty, you retrieve the latest version. Is empty by default.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters (excluding version) is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid or when the retrieved model could not be loaded.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static retrieve_model(projectName, branchName, userid, version=None, format=<ModelFormat.JSON: 'json'>)[source]¶

Retrieves a raw model string in the specified format from the repository, matching the parameters provided.

Returns:

A raw model string of the model that matches the parameters provided.
Return type:

str
Parameters:
  • projectOwner (str) – The username of the owner of the project containing the model.
  • projectName (str) – The name of the project containing the model.
  • branchName (str) – The specific branch of the model you wish to retrieve.
  • userid (str) – The name of the user performing this action.
  • version (long) – Optional.The version of the model you wish to retrieve. If you leave this empty, you retrieve the latest version. Is empty by default.
  • format (ModelFormat) – Optional. The format in which you wish to retrieve the model. Defaults to ModelFormat.JSON.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters (excluding version) is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
class m4i_analytics.graphs.languages.archimate.ArchimateUtils.ModelFormat[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Each entry corresponds to a format in which a model can be encoded. XML corresponds to the Open Group XML Exchange format.

ARCHI = 'archimate'¶
JSON = 'json'¶
XML = 'xml'¶
